gameplay

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the players participating in the game, including the pieces they hold as well as their hands.
    It is important to note that a player's color uniquely identifies the player.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Team 10 - SOEN6441

      • addCityCard

        public boolean addCityCard(AnkhMorporkArea a)
        Adds the city area card corresponding to the given area to the player's hand. The card cannot be used until the next round, unless it is Small Gods.

      • removeCityCard

        public boolean removeCityCard(AnkhMorporkArea a)
        Removes the city area card corresponding to the given area from the player's hand.

      • disableCityAreaCard

        public boolean disableCityAreaCard(AnkhMorporkArea a)
        Disabled the City Area card for the given area owned by the player. Use with caution: it should be checked beforehand whether the player has this card.
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:
        true if the city area card was disabled successfully.

        public java.util.Set<? extends Card> getPlayableCards()
        Returns:
        the cards a player can play during his turn (currently either Green Player cards or City Area cards).

      • resetCityAreaCards

        public void resetCityAreaCards()
        Resets this player's city area cards' "played" state to false. It should be used at the beginning of a round.

      • getLoanBalance

        public int getLoanBalance()
        Retrieves the amount owed by the player due to having "loan" cards (GreenPlayerCard.MR_BENT, GreenPlayerCard.THE_BANK_OF_ANKH_MORPORK).
        Returns:

      • canProtectPieces

        public boolean canProtectPieces()
        If the player has the Small Gods (s)he can protect pieces and buildings: "Whenever one of your minions or buildings is affected by a random event you can pay $3 to ignore the effect. If more than one piece is affected then you must pay $3 for each piece you wish to protect." This function encapsulates this functionality by first checking if the player can use Small Gods and then asking the player if (s)he wants to do so. Every time this player's piece or building is affected this function should be called to check if protection is applicable.
        Returns:
        true if the player owns Small Gods and can pay to protect a piece (has money and this city area card is active), false otherwise.
